about_the_game:
Unemployment Simulator is a first-person life simulation game that immerses you in the challenging world of navigating life without a steady income. Set in a modern-day environment, this game puts you in the shoes of someone newly unemployed, where every decision you make could determine your survival. From managing your basic needs like food, hygiene, and sleep to engaging with the digital world in search of employment, Unemployment Simulator offers a unique and thought-provoking experience that mirrors the struggles of real life.

Experience the Harsh Reality of Unemployment

In Unemployment Simulator, you’re thrust into a world where your day begins with waking up in the middle of a cluttered apartment. The fridge might be nearly empty, the bills are piling up, and the stress is palpable. Every moment counts as you strive to make it through each day, not just physically, but mentally as well.

You’ll need to keep an eye on your essential needs—food, drink, hygiene, and sleep—while also managing your finances. With no steady income, every dollar counts, and the choices you make will have direct consequences on your ability to survive. Will you buy groceries or save up for rent? Should you spend time job hunting, or do you need to take a day off to preserve your mental health?

Engage in Real-World Simulated Activities

The game offers a wide range of activities that simulate real-life tasks:

  • Start your day: Wake up, tidy up your space, and plan how you’ll navigate the challenges ahead.
  • Hygiene matters: Take a shower, brush your teeth, and maintain your personal hygiene to keep your morale high.
  • Search for a job: Use your computer and phone to browse job listings, send out resumes, and prepare for interviews.
  • Manage your resources: Buy groceries, cook meals, and make sure you have enough to eat and drink.
  • Stay connected: Interact with the outside world through social media, emails, and phone calls.
  • Unwind or unravel: At the end of the day, choose how to wind down—whether it’s reading a book, watching TV, or turning to more destructive habits like drinking yourself into a stupor.

Survival Elements

Survival isn’t just about finding food and shelter. In Unemployment Simulator, you must also manage your energy levels, mental health, and financial stability. How you balance these needs will determine how long you can survive the harsh realities of unemployment.

  • Energy: Keep your energy up by sleeping and eating regularly. Ignore these, and you’ll find yourself too tired to search for jobs or even get out of bed.
  • Mental Health: Stress is a constant companion. Take time to relax and engage in activities that reduce stress, or risk falling into depression, which can further complicate your situation.
  • Finances: Money is tight, and every purchase must be carefully considered. Choose wisely between essential needs and luxuries, as running out of funds can lead to eviction and game over.

A Realistic Challenge

Unemployment Simulator doesn’t sugarcoat the experience. It’s designed to be a challenging simulation that reflects the difficulties many face when unemployed. Whether you find a way to thrive or struggle to get by, each playthrough offers a unique story shaped by your choices.

Key Features

  • First-person life simulation with a focus on the challenges of unemployment.
  • Realistic survival mechanics that include managing food, drink, energy, and money.
  • Engage in daily activities such as job hunting, cooking, cleaning, and social interactions.
  • Dynamic stress and mental health system that affects gameplay based on your decisions.
  • Multiple endings based on your success or failure in navigating unemployment.

Will You Survive the Struggles of Unemployment?

Step into a world where every choice matters, and every day is a new battle for survival. Unemployment Simulator offers a raw and unfiltered look at the realities of life without a job. Can you find a way to make ends meet, or will you succumb to the pressures of unemployment?

content_descriptors.notes:
Please be advised that "Unemployment Simulator" contains depictions of alcohol consumption as part of its realistic portrayal of life challenges. The game may include scenarios where the player character can choose to engage in drinking behavior, which can affect gameplay outcomes.

This content is intended for mature audiences and to reflect real-life situations. It is not meant to promote or glorify excessive alcohol use. Players are encouraged to make responsible choices both in-game and in real life.

If you or someone you know is struggling with alcohol abuse, please seek help from appropriate support services.

pc_requirements.minimum:
Minimum:
  • Requires a 64-bit processor and operating system
  • OS: Windows 10 64-bit
  • Processor: Intel Core i3 3.0 GHz or Ryzen 3xxx
  • Memory: 8 GB RAM
  • Graphics: Nvidia GeForce GTX 960 4GB VRAM
  • Storage: 5 GB available space
pc_requirements.recommended:
Recommended:
  • Requires a 64-bit processor and operating system
  • OS: Windows 11 64-bit
  • Processor: Intel Core i5
  • Memory: 16 GB RAM
  • Graphics: NVidia GeForce GTX 1070 or better 6GB VRAM
  • Storage: 10 GB available space

short_description: Navigate the challenges of life without a job in Unemployment Simulator, a first-person survival experience where you manage your day-to-day needs, search for work, and try to stay afloat. Balance basic needs like food, hygiene, and sanity while facing the harsh realities of unemployment.
